thread.title: Awkward live mic feed of Katy Perry’s Grammys performance leaks
thread.title_full: Awkward live mic feed of Katy Perry’s Grammys performance leaks

author: Rob Moran
title: Awkward live mic feed of Katy Perry’s Grammys performance leaks
text:
Dad jailed for suffocating his toddler daughter Awkward live mic feed of Katy Perry’s Grammys performance leaks ROB MORAN Last updated 12:40, February 22 2017 
Audio from Katy Perry's live mic at her Grammy performance has been leaked and fans are critical. 
This should make you feel good about your boozy, off-key Friday night karaoke renditions of Sia's Chandelier. 
Some online troublemaker (Taylor Swift?) has leaked the isolated live vocals from pop star Katy Perry's onstage performance at last week's Grammys, and the results are warbly to say the least. 
The clip highlights Perry's vocals front-and-centre without the bells and whistles of a backing track, as she mangles notes and struggles to catch her breath. GETTY IMAGES 
It's the kind of performance Mariah Carey might've shut down mid-song . 
READ MORE: 
The pop star, long criticised for her lack of vocal range, took the stage at the Grammys with Bob Marley's grandson Skip for a rendition of her anticipated comeback single Chained to the Rhythm . HOLLYSCOOP 
Katy Perry is back on the scene with the release of her music video for “Chained to the Rhythm.” And let’s just say, it’s a tad weird, but that’s typical Katy Perry. 
But the performance, coming mere minutes after Beyonce's scene-stealing extended ode to motherhood , was panned by viewers, both for its shaky delivery and vague political jabs, with the duo ending the song in front of a projection of the US constitution. 
Despite the awkward live debut, the single – co-written by Sia and Max Martin – has quickly become a top five hit, because no one listens to vocals on the radio anyway. It also set a record on Spotify for highest first-day streaming for a single by a female artist. 
The clip is a stark contrast to a similar mic feed leaked from Lady Gaga's performance at the Super Bowl earlier this month, which showcased the singer's powerful vocals. 
The clip, which saw Gaga kick off a medley of her biggest hits with a mashup of God Bless America and Woody Guthrie's This Land Is Your Land – which many read as a subtle protest of Donald Trump's divisive policies – quickly went viral, racking up over a million views and praise for the singer. 
"Can she sing? You don't say. A singer should be able to sing," wrote one commenter. 
Well, not necessarily, it seems. - Sydney Morning Herald
